test-case.sql: SELECT user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id LIMIT ?
SELECT user_id, SUM(order_id) AS orders_sum FROM t_order GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY SUM(order_id) LIMIT ?
SELECT o.user_id uid FROM t_order o GROUP BY o.user_id ORDER BY o.user_id
SELECT SUM(order_id) AS orders_sum, user_id as `key` FROM t_order GROUP BY `key`
SELECT order_id, COUNT(DISTINCT order_id) c FROM t_order WHERE order_id < 1100 GROUP BY order_id ORDER BY order_id
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT order_id) c, order_id FROM t_order GROUP BY order_id ORDER BY order_id
SELECT COUNT(order_id) AS orders_count, user_id FROM t_order GROUP BY 2 ORDER BY 2
SELECT country_id, COUNT(1) FROM t_merchant WHERE business_code LIKE '%18' GROUP BY country_id
test-case.scenario-comments: Test single table's LIKE operator percentage wildcard in select group by statement when use sharding feature.|Test encrypt table's LIKE operator percentage wildcard in select group by statement when use encrypt feature.

test-case.sql: SELECT country_id, COUNT(1) FROM t_merchant WHERE business_code LIKE '_1000018' GROUP BY country_id
test-case.scenario-comments: Test single table's LIKE operator underscore wildcard in select group by statement when use sharding feature.|Test encrypt table's LIKE operator underscore wildcard in select group by statement when use encrypt feature.

test-case.sql: SELECT COUNT(1) FROM t_order WHERE 1 = 2 GROUP BY order_id,user_id ORDER BY user_id
test-case.scenario-comments: Test GROUP BY with ORDER BY different fields returns no rows when WHERE condition matches no data

test-case.sql: SELECT AVG(DISTINCT order_id) AS avg_id FROM t_order WHERE 1 = 2
test-case.scenario-comments: Test AVG DISTINCT returns NULL when no data matches

test-case.sql: SELECT SUM(DISTINCT order_id) AS sum_id FROM t_order WHERE 1 = 2
test-case.scenario-comments: Test SUM DISTINCT returns NULL when no data matches

test-case.sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT order_id) AS count_id FROM t_order WHERE 1 = 2
test-case.scenario-comments: Test COUNT DISTINCT returns 0 when no data matches

test-case.sql: SELECT MIN(DISTINCT order_id) AS min_id FROM t_order WHERE 1 = 2
test-case.scenario-comments: Test MIN DISTINCT returns NULL when no data matches

test-case.sql: SELECT MAX(DISTINCT order_id) AS max_id FROM t_order WHERE 1 = 2
test-case.scenario-comments: Test MAX DISTINCT returns NULL when no data matches

test-case.sql: SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS user_count FROM t_user GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY user_id
